body:
@SteveL-MSFT after move to netcore2.0 this Azure.NetCore modules don't work anymore with powershell beta-1

```
PS /Users/vors/dev/PowerShell> import-module AzureRM.NetCore.Preview            
Import-Module : Exception has been thrown by the target of an invocation.
At line:1 char:1
+ import-module AzureRM.NetCore.Preview
+ ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
    + CategoryInfo          : NotSpecified: (:) [Import-Module], TargetInvocat 
   ionException
    + FullyQualifiedErrorId : System.Reflection.TargetInvocationException,Micr 
   osoft.PowerShell.Commands.ImportModuleCommand
 
PS /Users/vors/dev/PowerShell> $error[0]                                        
Import-Module : Exception has been thrown by the target of an invocation.
At line:1 char:1
+ import-module AzureRM.NetCore.Preview
+ ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
    + CategoryInfo          : NotSpecified: (:) [Import-Module], TargetInvocat 
   ionException
    + FullyQualifiedErrorId : System.Reflection.TargetInvocationException,Micr 
   osoft.PowerShell.Commands.ImportModuleCommand
 
PS /Users/vors/dev/PowerShell> $error[0].Exception                              
Exception has been thrown by the target of an invocation.
PS /Users/vors/dev/PowerShell> $error[0].Exception.InnerException               
The type initializer for 
'Microsoft.Azure.Commands.ResourceManager.Common.AzureRMCmdlet' threw an 
exception.
PS /Users/vors/dev/PowerShell> $error[0].Exception.InnerException.InnerException                                                                                
The type initializer for 
'Microsoft.Azure.Commands.Common.Authentication.AzureSession' threw an 
exception.
PS /Users/vors/dev/PowerShell> $error[0].Exception.InnerException.InnerException.InnerException                                                                 
Could not load type 'Microsoft.PowerShell.CoreClr.Stubs.ICloneable' from 
assembly 'System.Management.Automation, Version=3.0.0.0, Culture=neutral, 
PublicKeyToken=31bf3856ad364e35'.
PS /Users/vors/dev/PowerShell> 
```

We should evaluate, do the regular Azure modules work and if so, just remove all documentation related to the preview. Otherwise we should ask azure team to rebuild and re-relase the preview.
@vors @gregdegruy I expect a new drop of AzureRM.NetCore.Preview to be published to the gallery "soon".  cc @joeyaiello
